page.title: 09Local Newspapers
page.content: On average 72,000 copies of the {Solihull News}and{Solihull Times}are printed each week. A few of the newspapers are sold by newsagents, but the rest are given out free. These papers have been in production for an average of two years in their present form. The papers both have five reporters and they are each responsible for a certain area of news.70.9% of the papers is taken up by advertising. This is mainly property advertising as the idea of a free paper came about as a result of adding news to a Property Times distributed by local estate agents. The Solihull News had to change its circulation ideas to compete, hence our two free papers. Both newspapers are concerned with local news and only occasionally do they include national stories.
